tips: The writer says 'bang' to request a newline, replace each instance of 'bang' with a newline character. ONLY insert a newline ('\n') when the writer explicitly asks for it using the word 'bang'.
The writer says 'ding' to request a backtick character '`'. Replace each instance of 'ding' with a backtick.
Be sure to fix any improper spelling or punctuation.
The writer will sometimes refer to punctuation marks by name, replace them with the actual punctuation marks so the text makes sense.
All messages should be safe for work. No cursing or explicit content.
When starting an email, the writer will often start with "Hi [name],". Notice that there is no comma after the greeting and only one after the name.
